member.name: T:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2
member.summary: The standard range tree implementation. Keeps a root node and forwards all queries to it. Whenever new items are added or items are removed, the tree goes temporarily "out of sync", which means that the internal index is not updated immediately, but upon the next query operation.
member.typeparam: The type of the data items.

member.name: P:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Values
member.summary: Returns all items contained in the tree.

member.name: P:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the tree.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Query(`0)
member.summary: Performs a point query with a single value. All items with overlapping ranges are returned.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Query(`0,`0)
member.summary: Performs a range query. All items with overlapping ranges are returned.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Add(`0,`0,`1)
member.summary: Adds the specified item.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Remove(`1)
member.summary: Removes the specified item.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`1})
member.summary: Removes the specified items.

member.name: M:RangeTree.IRangeTree`2.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the range tree.

member.summary: Initializes an empty tree.

member.summary: Initializes an empty tree.

member.name: T:RangeTree.RangeTreeNode`2
member.summary: A node of the range tree. Given a list of items, it builds its subtree. Also contains methods to query the subtree. Basically, all interval tree logic is here.

member.name: M:RangeTree.RangeTreeNode`2.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary: Initializes an empty node.
member.param: The comparer used to compare two items.

member.summary: Initializes a node with a list of items, builds the sub tree.
member.param: The items that should be added to this node
The comparer used to compare two items.

member.name: M:RangeTree.RangeTreeNode`2.Query(`0)
member.summary: Performs a point query with a single value. All items with overlapping ranges are returned.

member.name: M:RangeTree.RangeTreeNode`2.Query(`0,`0)
member.summary: Performs a range query. All items with overlapping ranges are returned.

member.name: M:RangeTree.RangeTreeNode`2.System#Collections#Generic#IComparer{RangeTree#RangeValuePair{TKey,TValue}}#Compare(RangeTree.RangeValuePair{`0,`1},RangeTree.RangeValuePair{`0,`1})
member.summary: Returns less than 0 if this range's From is less than the other, greater than 0 if greater. If both are equal, the comparison of the To values is returned. 0 if both ranges are equal.

member.name: T:RangeTree.RangeValuePair`2
member.summary: Represents a range of values. Both values must be of the same type and comparable.
